name: Hospederia de El Churrasco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful little hotel with bags of personality and charm. Our room was on the small side but fine for one night and had a touch of luxury. Perfectly located in the centre of Cordoba. Lovely to have breakfast in the courtyard. The only downside when driving is that it is impossible to find without satnav and the streets are very narrow!
reviews.title: First class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very warm welcome and helpful staff. Our room was beautifully furnished with antiques and exceptionally clean. The beds were very comfortable with fresh white sheets. Good air conditioning. Bathroom full of nice toiletries and huge fluffy towels and gowns. Huge TV and our own internet computer and wifi. Absolutely delightful. Excellent location right in the heart of the old town.
reviews.title: Delightful small hotel

reviews.text: A unique little find, hidden in the backstreets of the Jewish Quarter. Stepping into the foyer is like stepping into an oasis of antiquity. We had two rooms, each was charmingly furnished with beautiful antiques, but completely different. The beds were comfortable and the aircon worked well. The bathrooms had extras like shaving kits and fluffy gowns. The service at the front desk was polished and professional. Breakfast in the little outdoor garden was simple but nice. Location: it took a while to get oriented, but the centre of the Jewish Quarter and the Mezquita and the Plaza Mayor are all only a short walk. My parents in their late seventies could reach all of these with ease. Staying here helped get the "feel" of another era.
reviews.title: Oasis of Antiquity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit hard to find in the narrow streets of Cordoba but so well worth it, a fabulous hotel in a great position with the most helpfull friendly staff. we could not have been happier the only problem being we only booked for one night and wished we had been staying longer.we would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: what a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I spent two nights here in early June. This small, charming hotel is well-situated in Cordoba's Jewish Quarter, surrounded by narrow winding streets within close walking distance of the Mezquita - cathedral, Alcázar and restaurants.
reviews.title: Prime Location and Top-Notch Service

reviews.text: Central, elegant and atmospheric. Five minute walk to the Mesquita in an area of excellent restaurants including the Churrasco’s own. Rooms are comfortable and beautifully decorated with antiques and equipped with computers with free internet and flat-screen televisions. A good breakfast in interesting surroundings. Driving to the hotel was a challenge, but the staff immediately took care of the car and gave us excellent directions for leaving town at the end of our stay. Staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: Central, elegant, atmospheric

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, until the time we left, the staff couldn’t have been more helpful and accommodating. The room was a very good size; it might have been a little over the top in the décor, but that was fun.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel I Have Ever Stayed At!

reviews.text: The location was great and the taxi driver took us there from the train station without incident. Our room was ready as soon as we arrived (11:00 am). The flat screen TV was huge and got a handful of international stations and plenty of Spanish stations.
reviews.title: small and gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great, but Cordoba is a confusing city, so make sure you get a map and are prepared to get lost. There were great tapas places and restaurants nearby and we had dinner at the restaurant associated with the hotel on our last night, which was very good. You have to visit just to watch them cook the meat.
reviews.title: Aristocratic, well located, and supremely friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of the hotel though is the staff. They went out of way to help us out and graciously spoke perfect English. They brought us room service breakfast, in fact we ordered so much they made two trips.
reviews.title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel
Deserves its #1 Rating
reviews.text: What an absolutely picturesque place. From the delightful staff who welcome you, almost literally, with open and welcoming arms, to the delightful oasis created by cool tiles and fountains when you walk in, and the charming room that was ready for us even though we arrived early. This is a small hotel with a big heart. Breakfast on the patio with a gnarled olive tree and warm sunshine starts your day and ensures that you feel that "God's in his heaven and all is right with the world". Lest I forget it is only a 5 minute walk to the Mezquita! Stay here if you go to Cordoba!!

reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Helpful.The hotel is right in the middle of town so it is close to everything.If you are worried about driving down narrow streets,maybe not best if you have a car. Once you are there though.They take the car to the hotel parking for you.Loved our stay here and adored Cordoba.
reviews.title: Quiet and Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very well maintained hotel close to the Mezquita. Cordoba is filled with tourists on foot- many of them passing right in front of the hotel, yet once inside the hotel there was a sense of peace and quiet. Common areas were light filled and comfortable. Our room was small but since we stayed for one night only it was more than adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Small Hotel Near Mezquita

reviews.text: We selected this hotel because we only had one day in Cordoba and wanted to be close to the Mezquita. It only has 9 rooms and we got the last one and probably the smallest room they had left. The staff was very nice but the bed was less memorable. If you are driving, be prepared to fold in your car mirrors to squeeze through tiny alleys. Your GPS will get you close but inevitably you will probably have to roll down the windows and start asking.
reviews.title: Great welcome and Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place really does take service to the next level in the most beautiful surroundings. We were welcomed by name and as we enjojed a welcome drink our bags were taken to our room. The room itself was excellent, tastefully decorated with beautiful furniture and fittings. The bathroom was modern and bright and the whirlpool bath was an unusual touch. The public rooms were similarly elegant. Breakfast could be taken in any of the public areas - as well as in your room. You had to ask for any extras you wanted at breakfast over and above the rolls and pastries set out and this took a little time but was fine. If you have a chance do go to the hotel's restaurant - the staff are as lovely as in the hotel and the food is memorable. This really is a little gem of a hotel.
reviews.title: The most memorable stay in our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like the other reviewers have said, a small hotel in the old town, just by the Mezquita. The rooms are roomy (as is the bathroom) and have character and charm. The staff are unobtrusinve yet attentive and very hospitable. Unlike big hotels not everything gets added to the bill, if they offer you a welcoming drink it's on the house.
reviews.title: Character, Charm and excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very quiet (although at nights there is some passing street noise, which wasn't a problem for us, but I guess could be for light sleepers?), so maybe it's more for couples.
reviews.title: Beautifully decorated in the heart of town

reviews.text: We had a lovely time there and recommend it.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We were thrilled with our experience at this small boutique hotel. It is exactly where you want to be in the heart of town, five minutes walk to the Mezquita. The staff could not do enough to help . I think it has only nine rooms so book early. The terrace overlooks the Mezquita and apparently the restaurant is internationally well known (we didn't try it).
reviews.title: A great hotel & very helpful staff

aka: Hospederia De El Churrasco Hotel Cordoba
description: In the heart of Cordoba, close to the narrow lanes of La Juderia, is this lovely little nine room inn which has associations with the famous restaurant El Churrasco. The en-suite rooms are each named after artists and are uniquely decorated with typical Andalusian furniture and antiques. All the nine rooms of the Hospederia de El Churrasco have a matrimonial double bed. They may facilitate twin beds only in the superior rooms.
